meanings.definition: Regarded with excessive fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The overfeared cat hid under the bed during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest was overfeared by the young children.
meanings.sent3: The overfeared spider turned out to be a harmless daddy longlegs.
meanings.sent4: Her overfeared imagination created monsters in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The overfeared roller coaster ride left her trembling with fear.

meanings.definition: To be overly afraid of something.
meanings.sent1: She overfeared the dentist appointment, imagining it would be painful.
meanings.sent2: He overfeared the dark alley and chose to take a different route.
meanings.sent3: The cat overfeared the cucumber, thinking it was a snake.
meanings.sent4: The child overfeared the monster under the bed, refusing to sleep alone.
meanings.sent5: The hiker overfeared the steep cliff, hesitating to take the next step.
